21#ifndef ZONE_NAME
22#define ZONE_NAME __func__
23#endif

25namespace v8 {
26namespace internal {
27
28// The Zone supports very fast allocation of small chunks of
29// memory. The chunks cannot be deallocated individually, but instead
30// the Zone supports deallocating all chunks in one fast
31// operation. The Zone is used to hold temporary data structures like
32// the abstract syntax tree, which is deallocated after compilation.
33//
34// Note: There is no need to initialize the Zone; the first time an
35// allocation is attempted, a segment of memory will be requested
36// through the allocator.
37//
38// Note: The implementation is inherently not thread safe. Do not use
39// from multi-threaded code.
40
41class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Zone final {
42 public:
43 Zone(AccountingAllocator* allocator, const char* name,
44 bool support_compression = false);
45 ~Zone();
46
47 // Returns true if the zone supports zone pointer compression.
48 bool supports_compression() const {
49 return COMPRESS_ZONES_BOOL && supports_compression_;
50 }
51
52 // Allocate 'size' bytes of uninitialized memory in the Zone; expands the Zone
53 // by allocating new segments of memory on demand using AccountingAllocator
54 // (see AccountingAllocator::AllocateSegment()).
55 //
56 // When V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is defined, the allocated bytes are
57 // associated with the provided TypeTag type.
58 template <typename TypeTag>
59 void* Allocate(size_t size) {
60#ifdef V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
61 return AsanNew(size);
62#else
63 size = RoundUp(size, kAlignmentInBytes);
64#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
65 if (V8_UNLIKELY(TracingFlags::is_zone_stats_enabled())) {
66 type_stats_.AddAllocated<TypeTag>(size);
67 }
68 allocation_size_for_tracing_ += size;
69#endif
70 if (V8_UNLIKELY(size > limit_ - position_)) {
71 Expand(size);
72 }
73
74 DCHECK_LE(position_, limit_);
75 DCHECK_LE(size, limit_ - position_);
76 DCHECK_EQ(0, position_ % kAlignmentInBytes);
77 void* result = reinterpret_cast<void*>(position_);
78 position_ += size;
79 return result;
80#endif // V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER
81 }
82
83 // Return 'size' bytes of memory back to Zone. These bytes can be reused
84 // for following allocations.
85 //
86 // When V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is defined, the deallocated bytes are
87 // associated with the provided TypeTag type.
88 template <typename TypeTag = void>
89 void Delete(void* pointer, size_t size) {
90 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(pointer);
91 DCHECK_NE(size, 0);
92 size = RoundUp(size, kAlignmentInBytes);
93#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
94 if (V8_UNLIKELY(TracingFlags::is_zone_stats_enabled())) {
95 type_stats_.AddDeallocated<TypeTag>(size);
96 }
97 freed_size_for_tracing_ += size;
98#endif
99
100#ifdef DEBUG
101 static const unsigned char kZapDeadByte = 0xcd;
102 memset(pointer, kZapDeadByte, size);
103#endif
104 }
105
106 // Allocates memory for T instance and constructs object by calling respective
107 // Args... constructor.
108 //
109 // When V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is defined, the allocated bytes are
110 // associated with the T type.
111 template <typename T, typename... Args>
112 T* New(Args&&... args) {
113 static_assert(alignof(T) <= kAlignmentInBytes);
114 void* memory = Allocate<T>(sizeof(T));
115 return new (memory) T(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
116 }
117
118 // Allocates uninitialized memory for 'length' number of T instances.
119 //
120 // When V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is defined, the allocated bytes are
121 // associated with the provided TypeTag type. It might be useful to tag
122 // buffer allocations with meaningful names to make buffer allocation sites
123 // distinguishable between each other.
124 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
125 T* AllocateArray(size_t length) {
126 static_assert(alignof(T) <= kAlignmentInBytes);
127 DCHECK_IMPLIES(is_compressed_pointer<T>::value, supports_compression());
128 DCHECK_LT(length, std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max() / sizeof(T));
129 return static_cast<T*>(Allocate<TypeTag>(length * sizeof(T)));
130 }
131
132 // Allocates a Vector with 'length' uninitialized entries.
133 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
134 base::Vector<T> AllocateVector(size_t length) {
135 T* new_array = AllocateArray<T, TypeTag>(length);
136 return {new_array, length};
137 }
138
139 // Allocates a Vector with 'length' elements and value-constructs them.
140 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
141 base::Vector<T> NewVector(size_t length) {
142 T* new_array = AllocateArray<T, TypeTag>(length);
143 std::uninitialized_value_construct_n(new_array, length);
144 return {new_array, length};
145 }
146
147 // Allocates a Vector with 'length' elements and initializes them with
148 // 'value'.
149 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
150 base::Vector<T> NewVector(size_t length, T value) {
151 T* new_array = AllocateArray<T, TypeTag>(length);
152 std::uninitialized_fill_n(new_array, length, value);
153 return {new_array, length};
154 }
155
156 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = std::remove_const_t<T>[]>
157 base::Vector<std::remove_const_t<T>> CloneVector(base::Vector<T> v) {
158 auto* new_array = AllocateArray<std::remove_const_t<T>, TypeTag>(v.size());
159 std::uninitialized_copy(v.begin(), v.end(), new_array);
160 return {new_array, v.size()};
161 }
162
163 // Return array of 'length' elements back to Zone. These bytes can be reused
164 // for following allocations.
165 //
166 // When V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is defined, the deallocated bytes are
167 // associated with the provided TypeTag type.
168 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
169 void DeleteArray(T* pointer, size_t length) {
170 Delete<TypeTag>(pointer, length * sizeof(T));
171 }
172
173 // Seals the zone to prevent any further allocation.
174 void Seal() { sealed_ = true; }
175
176 // Allows the zone to be safely reused. Releases the memory except for the
177 // last page, and fires zone destruction and creation events for the
178 // accounting allocator.
179 void Reset();
180
181 size_t segment_bytes_allocated() const { return segment_bytes_allocated_; }
182
183 const char* name() const { return name_; }
184
185 // Returns precise value of used zone memory, allowed to be called only
186 // from thread owning the zone.
187 size_t allocation_size() const {
188 size_t extra = segment_head_ ? position_ - segment_head_->start() : 0;
189 return allocation_size_ + extra;
190 }
191
192 // When V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is not defined, returns used zone memory
193 // not including the head segment.
194 // Can be called from threads not owning the zone.
195 size_t allocation_size_for_tracing() const {
196#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
197 return allocation_size_for_tracing_;
198#else
199 return allocation_size_;
200#endif
201 }
202
203 // Returns number of bytes freed in this zone via Delete<T>()/DeleteArray<T>()
204 // calls. Returns non-zero values only when V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS is
205 // defined.
206 size_t freed_size_for_tracing() const {
207#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
208 return freed_size_for_tracing_;
209#else
210 return 0;
211#endif
212 }
213
214 AccountingAllocator* allocator() const { return allocator_; }
215
216#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
217 const TypeStats& type_stats() const { return type_stats_; }
218#endif
219
220#ifdef DEBUG
221 bool Contains(void* ptr);
222#endif
223
224 private:
225 void* AsanNew(size_t size);
226
227 // Deletes all objects and free all memory allocated in the Zone.
228 void DeleteAll();
229
230 // Releases the current segment without performing any local bookkeeping
231 // (e.g. tracking allocated bytes, maintaining linked lists, etc).
232 void ReleaseSegment(Segment* segment);
233
234 // All pointers returned from New() are 8-byte aligned.
235 // ASan requires 8-byte alignment. MIPS also requires 8-byte alignment.
236 static const size_t kAlignmentInBytes = 8;
237
238 // Never allocate segments smaller than this size in bytes.
239 static const size_t kMinimumSegmentSize = 8 * KB;
240
241 // Never allocate segments larger than this size in bytes.
242 static const size_t kMaximumSegmentSize = 32 * KB;
243
244 // The number of bytes allocated in this zone so far.
245 std::atomic<size_t> allocation_size_ = {0};
246
247 // The number of bytes allocated in segments. Note that this number
248 // includes memory allocated from the OS but not yet allocated from
249 // the zone.
250 std::atomic<size_t> segment_bytes_allocated_ = {0};
251
252 // Expand the Zone to hold at least 'size' more bytes.
253 // Should only be called if there is not enough room in the Zone already.
254 V8_NOINLINE V8_PRESERVE_MOST void Expand(size_t size);
255
256 // The free region in the current (front) segment is represented as
257 // the half-open interval [position, limit). The 'position' variable
258 // is guaranteed to be aligned as dictated by kAlignment.
259 Address position_ = 0;
260 Address limit_ = 0;
261
262 AccountingAllocator* allocator_;
263
264 Segment* segment_head_ = nullptr;
265 const char* name_;
266 const bool supports_compression_;
267 bool sealed_ = false;
268
269#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
270 TypeStats type_stats_;
271 std::atomic<size_t> allocation_size_for_tracing_ = {0};
272
273 // The number of bytes freed in this zone so far.
274 std::atomic<size_t> freed_size_for_tracing_ = {0};
275#endif
276
277 friend class ZoneScope;
278};
279
280// Similar to the HandleScope, the ZoneScope defines a region of validity for
281// zone memory. All memory allocated in the given Zone during the scope's
282// lifetime is freed when the scope is destructed, i.e. the Zone is reset to
283// the state it was in when the scope was created.
284class ZoneScope final {
285 public:
286 explicit ZoneScope(Zone* zone);
287 ~ZoneScope();
288
289 private:
290 Zone* const zone_;
291#ifdef V8_ENABLE_PRECISE_ZONE_STATS
292 const size_t allocation_size_for_tracing_;
293 const size_t freed_size_for_tracing_;
294#endif
295 const size_t allocation_size_;
296 const size_t segment_bytes_allocated_;
297 const Address position_;
298 const Address limit_;
299 Segment* const segment_head_;
300};
301
302// ZoneObject is an abstraction that helps define classes of objects
303// allocated in the Zone. Use it as a base class; see ast.h.
304class ZoneObject {
305 public:
306 // The accidential old-style pattern
307 // new (zone) SomeObject(...)
308 // now produces compilation error. The proper way of allocating objects in
309 // Zones looks like this:
310 // zone->New<SomeObject>(...)
311 void* operator new(size_t, Zone*) = delete; // See explanation above.
312 // Allow non-allocating placement new.
313 void* operator new(size_t size, void* ptr) { // See explanation above.
314 return ptr;
315 }
316
317 // Ideally, the delete operator should be private instead of
318 // public, but unfortunately the compiler sometimes synthesizes
319 // (unused) destructors for classes derived from ZoneObject, which
320 // require the operator to be visible. MSVC requires the delete
321 // operator to be public.
322
323 // ZoneObjects should never be deleted individually; use
324 // Zone::DeleteAll() to delete all zone objects in one go.
325 // Note, that descructors will not be called.
326 void operator delete(void*, size_t) { UNREACHABLE(); }
327 void operator delete(void* pointer, Zone* zone) = delete;
328};
329
330// The ZoneAllocationPolicy is used to specialize generic data
331// structures to allocate themselves and their elements in the Zone.
332class ZoneAllocationPolicy {
333 public:
334 // Creates unusable allocation policy.
335 ZoneAllocationPolicy() : zone_(nullptr) {}
336 explicit ZoneAllocationPolicy(Zone* zone) : zone_(zone) {}
337
338 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
339 V8_INLINE T* AllocateArray(size_t length) {
340 return zone()->AllocateArray<T, TypeTag>(length);
341 }
342 template <typename T, typename TypeTag = T[]>
343 V8_INLINE void DeleteArray(T* p, size_t length) {
344 zone()->DeleteArray<T, TypeTag>(p, length);
345 }
346
347 Zone* zone() const { return zone_; }
348
349 private:
350 Zone* zone_;
351};
352
353} // namespace internal
354} // namespace v8
355
356// The accidential old-style pattern
357// new (zone) SomeObject(...)
358// now produces compilation error. The proper way of allocating objects in
359// Zones looks like this:
360// zone->New<SomeObject>(...)
361void* operator new(size_t, v8::internal::Zone*) = delete; // See explanation.
362void operator delete(void*, v8::internal::Zone*) = delete; // See explanation.
363
364#endif // V8_ZONE_ZONE_H_
